title: Strictly Come Dancing: Kate Silverton apologises for spoiling Dev exit
text:
Kate Silverton accidentally revealed the results of last night’s Strictly elimination before it aired (Picture: Getty)

BBC newsreader Kate Silverton has apologised for accidentally sharing the result of last night’s Strictly Come Dancing elimination before it aired.

The 49-year-old, who appeared on the last series of the show, retweeted the news that Dev Griffin and his professional partner Dianne Buswell had been booted from the competition when the information leaked early on Twitter.

Sharing the with her outcome with her 56,200 followers prematurely, the post read: ‘#strictlyspoiler how has dev been kicked off?? [sic]

‘He was literally 2nd on the leaderboard last week and 3rd over all last week? And because of one ‘bad’ dance he’s gone? When I tried to ring up for him and Dianne it didn’t let me so I think that’s why he has been kicked off #fuming.’

Kate quickly realised her error though when angry viewers replied and began telling her that she’d ‘spoiled’ the results.

Kate shared a spoiler (Picture: Twitter)

Kate apologised for her error (Picture: Twitter)

Taking ownership of the blunder, she then tweeted: ‘Oh my goodness – I have spent the day with my family offline & and just catching up with this – as someone who clearly knows all too well the fundamental issue around #stricrlyspoilers I hand on heart can say this was an entirely unintentional “retweet”.’

In another post, Kate added: ‘I was watching with my mum on catch up – last midnight so with tired eyes…

Dev and Dianne were eliminated (Picture: BBC)

‘I certainly don’t retweet anything like this as my followers will know but for anyone who has had their wonderful @bbcstrictly magic ruined I must apologise & again pls accept as entirely unintentional.’

Strictly fans are up in arms about the news of Dev’s departure, with many claiming they couldn’t vote for the radio presenter due to jammed phone lines.

After the show was aired, Dianne posted a smiley photo of the pair behind-the-scenes of their week one routine to Build Me Up Buttercup.

The Australian native admitted she wasn’t ready to end her run with Dev on the show and wrote: ‘My heart is broken. this guy had so much to give and worked sooooo hard I’m so sorry your journey was cut short you have done me so proud, every week you would say you just didn’t want to let me down!

‘Dev you sooo didn’t you were a dream to teach and you were turning into such a great dancer thank you so much for everything.’

Strictly Come Dancing returns Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.
